Although it may be understandable because they are pretty busy, this place is not the place to be if you expect any attention from the staff. Im not asking for the service a super expensive restaurant would give but the staff here are just plain rude. Food not good enough to come back. The staff here just frustrates people. No wonder their reviews are so low. Shitty service = no tip. Id rather go to mcdonalds.

rwWHqbD6bjpe1tsA9m2FbQ.text: This place was not bad in my opinion, but it was not that good compared to the Van Nuys one in Los Angeles. The prices were more expensive and the food quality was lower, and the chicken lo mein dish I got was just too greasy.  I guess this is a main part of the small Chinatown in Las Vegas, which is essentially just a strip mall. However, it really is nothing special.  Oh yeah, and this place is cash only.

H8XSWy3nmiik7ewqOVFhQw.text: My wife and I had a dinner on a Sunday night and I honestly wasn't that impressed. To me the prices here seemed pretty high for the amount of food you actually get. Example: the BBQ Combination Plate which had the BBQ Pork, Roast Duck and Chicken.  We were excited to order it but when we received it what a huge let down.   The serving size was pretty small and for the price (I believe it was $16.99) you'd expect it to be much larger. As far as the actual taste.....Hell, I've had better Chinese BBQ at the 99 Ranch in Chino Hills here in Cali.  Also, it had to have the filthiest bathroom that I've seen in awhile which really made wonder about the cleanliness of the place overall.   Overall an underwhelming experience I'd say don't waste your time here.

BA8M7YJpHXz4cyBtBLTvng.text: Everytime in Las Vegas, must come. Having lunch this time with my family. Order four dishes inculding BBQ Pork which is not fresh and reheated, texture is  strange. Beef egg noodle even worst, taste was even strange and suffer... Food use to be ok here but no more.... Disappointed

lFEgc61biqMLtl40lhUAqA.text: The crispy noodles with duck are the best, I know it has 2 stars but zagat surveys and awards are on the wall. They also have food to go. Do not misjudge the reviews here. Way better than it looks

mnGN2zQdOjwkwuzjqdk05w.text: Let me start by telling you that we are a big fan of Sam Woos. We were in Vegas on New Year's Eve, and we rushed this one to make sure we beat the evening crowd. At most restaurants you would end up having to wait and we thought this one would be packed. It wasn't, and for good reason. I've been to several different Sam Woo BBQs and this is by far the the worst one. This can only be described as a Sam woo in the name only. The food is terrible, the service was terrible. When we got to check, they did not to mention that the tip was included in the check. Most of the tables at the restaurant had paid the tip twice! And they didn't deserve any tip!Service was so bad I was looking forward to going to the DMV for my next meal. Trust me there's no reason to find out for yourself how bad it is. I wish we had checked the reviews before we came. We ordered roast pork, roast duck, house special chow mein, wonton soup, and one vegetable dish. Roast pork was disappointing, cold, and cut super thick. Duck was cold and thin. The special chow mein was too oily and flavorless. And wonton soup was unimpressive. Just don't go. And if you go don't leave a tip. It's already in your check.

bWC45rHY-lnzzC8JtcltCg.text: What happened to this place?  It used to be great!  Now they can teach a clinic on how not to run a restaurant.  Terrible non existent service ...check. Bait and switch pricing on the menu versus the final bill...check. Inconsistent food quality between dishes...check.  Smelly disgusting restrooms...check.  Such a shame.  At least the manager was nice when we complained.

ZBlYX587oSgx51xhj9L2Og.text: I went here many years ago. Since Joel and I were in the area we stopped in for a late lunch.   I've read other people's reviews about Sam Woo. It comes down to if you don't mind slow service it's perfectly fine. Their food was excellent.   Sam Woo only excepts cash so make sure you have some on you. We were seated quickly and green tea was brought out to us. Their menu is gigantic! Omg talk about all the things. It seriously made it hard to pick. I knew I wanted something that had their tasty duck. When you first walk into Sam Woo's you are greeted by ducks that are cooking behind glass. After looking over the menu several times Joel and I both decided on the Duck Wonton soup with noodles.   It took a while for it to come out. But when it did that was one huge bowl of soup. It was literally filled to the brim. I was shocked the waiter didn't spill any out of either bowls on the way over to our table. On the top of the soup were sliced pieces of crispy duck. Mmmm duck skin. The broth was delicious and omg the wontons. There were probably 6 huge wontons and when I broke them open you could see actual shrimp in the meat mixture. They were so tasty. At the bottom of the bowl were noodles that I'm pretty sure we're made in house. What a tasty bowl of soup. All the ingredients worked so well together.   Now the wait for the check and a to go container for my soup. It was about 15 minutes until we got our check. Once our waiter came an got our check and money he did bring our change back quickly.   Not really sure why the service is so slow at Sam Woo. There weren't that many people there, but then again there was only one waiter. The food was so good it really didn't matter. If I'm in the Chinatown area I'll for sure stop in for that crispy duck!

photos.caption: Photo of Sam Woo BBQ Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck Wonton Soup with noodles

xNG-EOocQBWJ0JHBI6pk7w.text: None of the food has any flavor.  So disappointing.  Even the tea had no flavor...that's a first time i've ever had tea with no flavor, i didn't think that was possible.  Now i understand why this place is always empty, even during rush hour times.  All the Sam Woo's i've had in California had amazing chefs who cooked their food so good with lots of flavor....so i was expecting the same thing here, but it was like a totally different restaurant.  The waiter and cashier looked really depressed like they didn't wanna be there.  Their menu isn't even the same as the usual Sam Woo restaurant....they had no Udon noodles, no  Shanghai noodles, no special Chow Fun noodles....it was an extremely limited and bland menu.

wUVVNGYvkencsZeKnH6xMw.text: Just DO NOT eat here! They served me RAW wontons and didn't apologize. They took my bowl of wontons noodles, removed the wontons, reheated the noodles and served me the SAME bowl of noodles.  Who does this?   RUDE staff.  There are BETTER Chinese restaurants in the area.

BdIAeagSy5xAQtPyUi4WcQ.text: Hmmm....   I wasn't thrilled with our last visit to Sam Woo in Los Angeles, and frankly I'm not sure why we chose to try Sam Woo in Vegas. We ordered a chicken dish which was' meh', and salt and pepper squid which I generally love ... but not here:  doughy, non-descript, under-seasoned. A waste of calories.  On the plus side, we did enjoy wonton noodle soup, which was similar to what we order in our favorite Malaysian restaurant.  The service?  Efficient.  Not friendly, not solicitous.  But it's the food that would deter me from coming back. Not the staff.

hb1kV8KsfeegQN-CygB02w.text: They only accept cash here!! Of course we saw the sign AFTER we ordered.  Conveniently they have an ATM right inside the restaurant. Hahah.  The MN girls and I are walkin' around China Town and it's time to pick a spot and get some grub! We decide on Sam Woo.  We got salt n' pepper calamari, beef chow fun and some kind of wonton soup.  Hunnie Bunnie really liked the chow fun. I loved the salt n' pepper calamari and the MN girl Donna thought the wonton soup hit the spot!  They also hook you up with some complimentary hot tea once you're seated. Yeaaah.

YX6IPPjb7noyScWYEabLlQ.text: I am disappointed in this place.  I ate there in person before and I ordered delivery through Grubuhub this time and the food was not good.  Beef with scrambled egg over rice is usually my go to Cantonese dish...it was bland and so full of rice.  The Singapore rice noodles...well they used the wrong noodles.  Instead of using the chewy thicker rice noodle, they used glass noodles.  The texture is just all wrong.  The Mongolian beef was pretty decent.  And they sent me the WRONG item.  They sent me bbq pork soup wonton noodles instead of bbq pork lo mein.  Very disappointing.  Of all the dishes, we only ate the Mongolian beef.  What a waste.

s9GExw464qQwz5gO9leJkw.text: Food was extremely subpar (we ordered a bbq rice plate, wonton noodle soup, and fried noodles). Rice was soggy, minimal meat quantity, and meat quality was just terrible.   They charge $2/table for tea.   They include mandatory tip in your bill. At the end of the meal, they gave us our bill with their "suggested" tip amount and then charged us that exact amount. On top of that, when they gave us our change (we paid in cash), they handed back an excessive amount of coins, I assume with the intention of encouraging us to leave the coins as additional tip.   Very disappointing experience. No comparison to other Sam Woo locations.

ehTsTx-N9vIsGs8WAhaqhQ.text: Why didn't I read the reviews first on this place before going. Why. The staff here is crazy rude and botched our take-out order to hell which didn't become obvious of course until we were home. It's insanely overpriced for a Chinese restaurant at $15 a dish and we were left with cold and tasteless food for dinner. Flat noodles and beef tasted like cardboard, clams in black bean sauce had four or five clams and the rest were empty shells, chicken wings had visible thick chunks (CHUNKS, not flakes) of MSG on them, and the vegetable dish we ordered was something else entirely. Bonus: we called back to point out this wrong order and they hung up.  Avoid this place at all costs. Yelpers got it right.  Oh, and cash only so they can duck the IRS.

C_iINckmswC6QudeCXwqUQ.text: As an avid fan of family/friend style chinese food. I definitely recommend this restruant. I always come here with a group of friends and order a few dishes and we're always stuffed amd satisfied. Service is pretty good and the staff tends to questions quickly! I recommend :)

UX_XxFpKQzCn00bC0EbNDg.text: Best magnolia beef love it. It my go to place for my birthday or a special occasion. I highly recommended you go here and try it. And don't forget to try it with the chicken fried rice.

ofB2MxdwiUtUX0_-UGxjog.text: Don't let the average rating deter you from trying them in Chinatown. Yes, service isn't going to be spectacular or super friendly, but the food is ok.   I'll be honest, the food wasn't as tasty or great as back in LA.  The salted fish and chicken fried rice didn't have any salted fish flavor and the chicken was rubbery. In LA, there might be variations that have shredded lettuce cooked with it and maybe that would have made this dish better.  The fish filet with veggie dish was average, nothing special. There was definitely more fish than veggies.   The beef with green onion dish was average as well. We were joking that this dish might taste good as a sandwich later on.   The pan fried chow fun was decent, but was oily like it normally should be for a dry noodle dish.   Sam Woo is know for their chopped meats (char siu, duck, chicken, cuttlefish, etc). When we ordered the char siu and fish combo, I was kind of disappointed because the dish was small and the cuts for duck weren't very meaty (mainly bones).   On the plus side, they serve their tea with very large tea cups!!!  Yelp 100 challenge - 40 of 100

-aokpo89dervshBo3Z-ENg.text: Decisions, decisions, decisions... But when it comes to Chinese food, this is the best comfort food. Had tofu, steak, noodles.

mHGZGaAedFQ750_6mQTPYw.text: Not the best, but very good. Place was packed and parking insane!! The parking was unbelievable. Stereotypes fit here. Fast, not courteous, not confident driving dare devils with attitude. After a 15 minute wait was seated in a dirty table, and after another 5 minutes was cleaned and the rice and noodle pieces left on the table top just thrown on dirty floor and seat. The place is not clean by outward appearance, but an A is in the window so hopefully the kitchen is. The restaurant is tiny, old and worn. The place appears to be beat up from all the traffic. Had KungPao chicken on recommendation from the hostess who was very nice. It was good, nothing amazing. The rice included rib, shrimp and chicken. It was delicious. All in all I would go again, but if I am in the mood for chinese in Vegas and want to go to this zoo of a strip mall I will try something else.

fAOUUBrBOPx04zgCcOpzgg.text: Bad service and nothing special about it..  Compared to other Sam Woo branch seriously, this branch doesn't really serve a good food..   Not a good value.. Don't waste your time and money here, especially if you're familiar with Sam Woo BBQ restaurants.

WSJ3JLRUTFkbpQ45LtO5hw.text: Oh no, Sam Woo Vegas, you are not the same as the one in Irvine.  Last year, this place had the best Roast Pig - but this year, not even comparable. The items I enjoyed were:  Roast Duck and Ong Choy. I'll save my Sam Woo visits for Culver Drive.

bsaSXlPIp7B2DFCLlWFkSQ.text: Growing up in Southern California, I will always be partial to Sam Woo BBQ. I purchased a variety of deli meats to go (roasted pork, some duck, some cha siu). I would not reccomend this place at all! they were closed before for a horrible food inspection grade of F. Your better off eating at panda express!

Pbrf8eDdbECA-gx0au--EA.text: I feel as if nothing here is clean from the food down to the workers.. Not to mention horrible service. But the food was pretty okay tasting.. Or maybe I was just really hungry? Whatever.

2B41315YBV9WqoqCpBUeSw.text: What legitimate business in the food industry does not accept credit cards in this day and age, or at least have decent signage for it right as you enter? Apparently that place is Sam Woo BBQ. My friend took a wrong turn on the way to Firefly and we ended up in Chinatown and she took me here saying it was decent. The bitch lied.   Walking in my appetite was immediately turned off with the hanging poultry and pigs in the entrance, but we carried on because we had a limited amount of time to eat with very limited options around. The place was dead which should have been a sign, but we got seated immediately but the decor was very.... off. I felt like I was in the 90's, maybe late 80's with the outdated surroundings. They did have hot tea that was waiting for us which was nice on the cold day, but this was essentially the only luxury we would be afforded.   Not much to be had for the vegetarian set, but I got some mixed vegetable fried rice for $9 freakin' dollars. Granted it was on a huge plate, but I expected a mountain of vegetables with my rice. I could hardly find any damn vegetables in the entire thing. Not okay. My friend got a pork fried rice dish which she said was okay, but that was $9 as well. Two people eating just fried rice with a bill of $18. A bill of $18 which could only be paid with cash as we found out. And you know where the closest ATM is? All the way back in the Chinatown mall. It took my friend 5 minutes to run out and run back in. This had to be a joke, or maybe a conspiracy with the ATM people. We left a $20 bill and got the hell out of there, the service did not even try to exceed minimum expectactions.  I was thinking about giving this place two stars because we did get seated quickly and the food didn't completely suck, but the experience sucked enough that I know I will never come back and there was no way in hell a very simplistic plate of VEGETABLES AND RICE costs $9. Also, they really should have decent signs or tell you BEFORE you sit down and order that it is cash only, something I have not heard in about a decade or so. And then on the way to class, my stomach was NOT happy. 1 star for you, you time-warped cash-only poultry-hanging freaks.

Ri5YoIpIYIP5YECc4nRLZA.text: A very quick comment: Over priced ! Bad service ! Dislike the cash deal! Sam Woo, I will not and never visit you again if I go to Vegas.

wlBv3cJwr94pmGEBWgYJlw.text: We came here only as last resort. Our experience really confirmed all the negative reviews online. The food is mediocre at best, HORRIBLE service. And best of all, tips are automatically included, so you can't even voice your discontent. Never again.

W0RMii5GiO4Ap5nFJ7HISQ.text: Walked in and saw a coach roach running on the floor. Think they forgot the leaves on my Chinese broccoli dish.

OxKQ2pQxMLFmihuLbrgl8Q.text: Really really bad service! We order noodles to go, and it takes very long. When we ask how long we need to wait more, the waiter told us "I don't know, but you only need to wait!" Bullshit! Btw, the kitchen is dirty!!

VnGYsPVT9YpjJlBFLZuNaw.text: Good variety of food and for the most part it was average nothing too special the look was nice , sleek and modern and the people were nice .

uiIH7jmT6F3tVru8F275XQ.text: My sister came to Vegas a couple of months ago and was raving about the roast duck she chowed on from Sam Woo.  She lives in San Francisco, and my parents were very skeptical about her excitement about this fabulous duck that she begged them to fly back with on their recent visit. (They refused.)  The Husband and I wanted to see if it was all quacked up as she said it was supposed to be.    Mission: Roast duck to go.  We did the quick take out side, although a peek at the menu definitely reflects that it's a better deal to take out if you can.  $12 for half a roast duck $19 for whole roast duck  It was pretty easy to go for the whole duck.  We also ordered a couple of boxes of steamed rice as well so we could eat on the run.  It was good - but then again, we haven't had any other roast duck in Vegas and it's been a long time since we've had roast duck in general.  Sure, I've had fattier ducks though than what Sam Woo offered, but there was definitely a good flavor in there.  The skin is the best part, but they could definitely have more meat on them.  We ate half last night and the other half tonight.  We think we got a pretty good deal on the duck and we were satisfied with that.  I spent some time living in SoCal, so I've had a few visits to Sam Woo BBQ there.  It definitely has me looking for other places that serve up roast duck though.  Cash only on the take out side.

M67YMXI_3iU63bhjc8cJiA.text: This will be a short review as we made our lunch there as short as possible. I would not recommend this place if you've been to Sam Woo in LA (lots betta') or if you truly have had good duck over rice recently. It'll put this place to shame. Service was as bad as the poorly roasted duck. I don't know how many times the waiter kept pestering us to see if we were finished eating yet. Seriously, try elsewhere in LV.

o2IbjCxyrxoTrxJdQc3CyQ.text: When you are away from home and craving some Hong Kong BBQ like Chinese food, Sam Woo is the place for you. Seriously. Every single Vegas trip I've been on, someone has always asked to eat Chinese food and we've either always ended up at Sam Woo's or at some Pho place. You can't go wrong with a fast and affordable meal.. not to mention familiar. Not to die for, but if you have the craving it's worth the taxi fare. Haha.

Z4QzB_1ff2CcKxyTTh-7jA.text: Probably one of the best chinese restaurants in vegas. I used to go here alot. Their food is authentic, good portions and reasonable prices. Come to this place if you want some real chinese cuisine.

RuuXFpCDirM2cXUC9KgcYA.text: I used to think this place was okay, until I parked right in front of the entrance one day and saw one of their waiters come outside, blowing a snot rocket right by the front door.  That was a complete turn-off and I backed out and drove away very disgusted.  Not only is that utterly disgusting, but who knows if he even washed his hands after!  I will never return there or recommend that place to anyone!

TByR9YyVbUWvhZ7ziZ5_Ug.text: My husband and I tried Sam Woo restaurant in Vegas and the food was not that great and customer service was horrible.  I ordered wonton roasted duck noodle and the broth was salty. When we went into the restaurant we waited to be seated and no one helped us.  We both seated ourselves.  The waiter gave us the bill while we were eating and I stopped eating to pay for our food.  The waiter didn't even ask if we were done with our food and took away our meal when I wasn't even done with it.  I find that it is very rude of the waiter to not even ask if we were done with our meal before taking it away.  I would never come back and would definitely not refer my friend to this restaurant.  The the price for the food was not worth paying for.

4KuMq_0qfMNJTWGIRCIySQ.text: Overpriced food.  For those of you coming from southern California, that are used to excellent food from this name, you will be disappointed.

Yg9toad6GhOn20TqvM0zkQ.text: This sam woo is only good when youre desparate for chinese food while being in the middle of the desert. Other Sam Woo like in La or in OC are better than this. The food is decent but what can you do if youre in vegas, when youre not a local finding some chinese.

9tn_HSHk2F1Rfk2wvfYDfw.text: Sam Woo, my favorite Chinese BBQ restaurant in the San Gabriel Valley.  Where else can I go for some good Cha Siu (BBQ Pork), Si Yuo Ji (Soy Sauce Chicken), etc.  So when I saw the LV location when we're driving around looking for a place to eat, I was definitely interested.  Going in, it looked the same as the LA locations, as is the "Cash Only" sign.  Being an expert of Chinese food in the SGV (Most are cash only) and being in Vegas, my friends and I carried plenty of cash.  We ordered a few dishes: Ping Pan (A mix of a few different BBQ), Lo Mein, Fried Rice, and a few stir-fry dishes.  The food was OK, I mean pretty much tasted the same as the ones in LA, so I had no complaints.  My only complaint was why did they jack up the prices by $2-3/per dish??  I mean in Vegas, the real estate is cheaper than LA, so are the gas prices, what's the need for a Lo Mein dish being $9?  Then, I remembered the Banana Cream Pie I had at Emril's in MGM being $9, so I guess this was a steal!  If you're sick of Buffets and in the mood for Chinese food, this is a decent location.

2a_sPqmEKgfw15XvDenXSw.text: On a morning breakfast hunger, we didn't feel like eatting buffetts with the regular eggs, sausages, omellettes.  We had a craving for some good old fashion "Jook" aka rice porridge.  We didn't wanted to go to Mandalay Bay which charges $25 for a Seafood Jook as compared to $4 in SF Chinatown.  So we picked the next best thing...in LV Chinatown and came about Sam Woo.    We ordered  a Fish Porridge which still had a strong fishy smell and taste, (usually removed with ginger) and the porridge was extremely watered down. We also order the "Sam See" chow mein (Duck; Chicken; and BBQ Pork)  It was ok, but tasteless...probably by the extreme amount of water sprouts!  Somehow, when we got back to the hotel that night, our stomach wasn't feeling too good.

UHSPIHc2leK8wNDstOyFbg.text: Very disappointed! Overpriced on Char Siew and Roast pork if you get them together on a small plate. What's even worse is the taste gone downhill!

rO97bTKXrbpEt-U60h3V9g.text: This restaurant has only the common name but nothing else good to be said about. The waiters were arrogant with a bad attitude. The food was lousy and expensive. We went there with high expectation because of our good experience with Sam Woo in LA but got so disappointed in this one. We will never go back again. Not sure how long they can still fooling people here.

AKg3eGW01oKgbm60L15STQ.text: If Yelp would allow NONE or NEGATIVE STARS, this restaurant would get it. My hubby and I are new Vegas residents, and we ventured into Chinatown hoping to satisfy our craving for good Chinese food.  We stumbled into Sam Woo, figuring it was a good bet since we knew Sam's in the Valley was the favorite restaurant of one of our friends.  WELL.   Strike ONE = the "hostess" didn't bother to get off her cell phone call when we walked in.  She handed us 2 menus and pointed to a table.  Yeah, didn't even walk us over.  Just chatted away while we seated ourselves. Strike TWO = the "server" wasn't friendly or anything.  I guess he was upset that we were making him do his JOB.  Of course the language barrier was no help either.  When he came over to our table, he didn't say hi, just "what you want order"?  WTF?  He slammed the tea pot on the table and spilled it.  What an A-hole. Strike THREE = the "food" sucked.  We ordered the BBQ Pork lo mein and the BBQ Pork fried rice.  The lo mein noodles smelled like FISH.  EWWW.  The fried rice was BLAND.  No amount of soy sauce could help it out.  NASTY.  The prices were ok, IF this had been a restaurant worth the money, about $8 per plate.  But since it ISN'T, $8 was too much to pay.   And, they only accept CASH - wanna roll into the 21st century like the rest of the world?    I will NEVER go here again.

h276g22UQjsnY06myvDLhQ.text: Horrible... just kill me now. Food/service was horrible. Too much oil in their food.  I got sick from here. =/

S0aaRuZC5CVT9s-ycC-GRA.text: Tourist trap! Pricey mediocre chinese food, not quite the same cheap eats Sam Woo like in San Gabriel, Cali. You'll be paying twice as much for a roast duck here and it's super salty. This place takes CASH ONLY!

qykmAywKwZGMYueRqfvf9Q.text: Man, has this place gone downhill I mean way down to the dark side. The place was so freaking dirty as if it was never been cleaned. We sat down at a round table and there was still sauce from the previous dinner, there was an unknown black object on one of the plate and another one on one of my chopsticks. Goddammit people when you set the table can't see it was still dirty. Clean it up you bunch lazy P.O.S. The pot of tea they threw on the table tasted more liked tea flavored water and it was hardly warm. At that point if my little girl weren't complaining hungry we would walked right out of there. I had a feeling this was not going to be good, so we ordered the bare minimum as not to waste any of our money. Not only had the price gone way up and the portion way down, the food was just simply bad, so bad I would nominate this place has the worst food in Vegas.

JVrDSC4UjLf7TrhSfIsJXg.text: ducks-chickens-pig there was a counter for whole meat purchases next to this display case all with their heads on smiling at you that is a whole hog head -eyes & all on the top right!! yummy!!! a small diner in chinatown-a few boothes-small & crowded-kinda dirty-tea pot was rusty & stained from the person that seated me, to the busboy, to the waiter, to the cashier-nobody spoke any english-i ordered #13 & food came instantly-had to find cashier to get check to pay & leave no attentive or friendly at all-seemed a little challenged if you know what i mean!! worse service than a buffett this place has a wall full of zagat & best of... awards?? how?? well i think i got what i ordered the menu said #13 bbq pork spare ribs i got them intantly-before my drink!! they were chopped int bits with lots of bone & grissle clearly visible it was hard & bony -no bbq flavor-very greasy & salty my jaw started hurting from having to chew so much after just a few pieces-i had to spit the last piece out!!  i have had 10x better ribs off the worst buffet  truly disappointing!! i noticed a lot of people were getting soup & noodles??! not your typical bbq i'd say  what is a chinese dessert?? anybody. from the strange things hanging in the window to the terrible food & service. don't waste your time & money. $10 buffet anywhere is better

WRC1eB9gcGiaLOI_0NrwkQ.text: i've been to my fair share of sam woo restaurants, the food is the same, but WHY THE HELL IS THIS ONE SO EXPENSIVE?!?!?

XW91ivvDyeWNZzDmMvOx6Q.text: we ordered porridge, chow mein, and i got a grass jelly drink. all the food was average chinese food. it's one of the only decent chinese restaurants that isn't fusion nor expensive in vegas.

Kt54aLo6Df-EUx3UN9ICKA.text: I'm a big fan of the duck.  Just bring cash if you eat here.  I've dined in as well as have ordered to go on numerous occasions.  This place doesn't have the best dining experience, but I come here for the food.

nOQiBAOHgLY5fsW3NuIV1Q.text: Terrible.  This place is always way too full, and the service is terrible.  The takeout portion food looks okay, but the servers don't use gloves or wash their hands. Aside from the wait, the tables are small, and the servers are inattentive.  We were without tea for a very long time.  The prices are decent, not too too expensive, but the food occasionally takes too long.    The tables can't be clean.  The way they wipe them down is to pour the previous party's unfinished tea on the tables, and use the napkins on the table to wipe them.  I've been here many times (because people I'm with like it), and it doesn't get better.  I will never agree to come back again.  Oh.  They're cash-only.  I never carry cash.

9cSXzwON66G0j2oZ0FdQIQ.text: Sam Woo is a Las Vegas CLASSIC! I think they are classically known for being bad though. I think the foodie invasion of Chinatown possibly ruined Sam Woo's reputation, but I had a great visit recently. I have fond memories of whole roasted pig and duck on holidays like New Years from here and they are delicious memories.  My best friend works graveyard and we aren't into The typical American style breakfast or Brunch all the time. We do however crave pork for breakfast. You can't put a time on crispy pork belly!   Anyways after deciding on Sam Woo over Chinese BBQ on Jones because Sam Woo takes cards we arrived right at opening around 10am. We were the only customers dining in and it was super cold.  I don't have much to say about the service but the food was great. We ordered fried intestines, roasted duck, crispy pan fried noodles, and crispy roasted pork. Man the food was great. The meat on the pork was so fatty and the skin was perfectly crisp and rendered. The duck had an awesome flavor and was cooked just perfect.  We had the restaurant to ourselves the whole time and enjoyed our food immensely. My only complaint at the restaurant was the cleanliness. Our table and silverware were clean, but the window I sat by had so much dirt and rice and old stuff on the bottom I just couldn't NOT mention it. It was like the bottom frame.  Anyways I did check out the reviews before I went in, but at the end of the day the food we ordered that day was just delicious.   So do check them out, don't sit by a window, and don't expect western style service and you will enjoy your food as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Sam Woo BBQ Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Intestines! Fried like fat potato chips. Definitely an acquired taste.
Photo of Sam Woo BBQ Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted duck.
Photo of Sam Woo BBQ Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy beef noodles.

EwZ2xaS2l383BNYF9xC6Kg.text: I was trapped by my Chinese gut while in Vegas, which told me that I could go to a buffet on the strip, but maybe you could just get good, cheap food and hit the slots with the extra money after. Well, none of that happened.   Apparently everyone's gut decided to speak up and send many to this restaurant, so it was packed and must be good! The place easily sat 50+ people but the place was staffed by 2.5 waiters (includes the host), so the service was bound to be slow. The staff wasn't very attentive, which made me heavily regret not going to a buffet and the plates of food I could have already stuffed my face with while waiting to order. Food is moderately priced, but what should be the focus here is seasoning in moderation because the saltiness of the general atmosphere there must have began to infiltrated their dishes.  The familiar ring of the words "Sam Woo" had too much influence and expectation centered around it, so it's honestly a bit of a tourist trap. Skip this line, get into that buffet line, and live it up while you're out here!

7SCNeS4Lxi0NLMpnobNySA.text: The service was bad. Our waitress seemed done for the day and was very indifferent.   The wonton noodles were too mushy and the porridge/congee was very very watery.   The only good thing was the two plates of vegetable that we ordered.

lxHvVybyAmmprwosFNPkoQ.text: (2/22/2019)  Came in for a late dinner with a family group of 13 travelling from LA.  We were pretty tired and hungry.  Ordered a dish each, it's not exactly like the usual family-style.  The concept is like Hong Kong butcher stalls/noodle shops, but the styling is definitively American.  Portions are enormous, way more than for 1 person, but it's not exactly a sharing environment.  Tried the 3-Flavor Chow Mein, a mix of three of their meat specialties, roasted duck, roasted chicken, and char siu, on pan-fried noodles; Seafood Chow Mein, a mix of bay scallops, squid, and shrimp on soft noodles, and Beef Stew Noodle Soup.  Good wok hay on the stir-fried dishes, but they were incredibly salty, and seriously over-sauced.  This is probably part of the American-style preparation, where people expect a lot of sauce on their noodles, like a plate of spaghetti.  The beef brisket in the noodle soup was pretty tender, broth was lacking on beefy flavor, lightly scented with star anise, soup noodles sufficiently springy.  Service was mostly attentive to the UNLV basketball game on TV, but came over when hailed.  Probably the best Chinese BBQ you'll find in Las Vegas (it's at the Chinatown Plaza).

Photo of Sam Woo BBQ Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed Seafood Chow Mein (soft noodle)

zgZUj7pc737A453KXPDSWg.text: Came here for a quick lunch and it was indeed QUICK! Questionably quick in fact - but hey if the food comes out so hot you burn your tongue, then it must be cooked to order. We ordered a noodle dish and a rice dish. Large portions  (or similar to that of other Sam Woo establishments) but a little pricer that usual - perhaps because it's the only Sam Woo in Vegas?  My total came out to be $23.   Overall, I didn't have too much of a expectation - I left a happy camper with a full tummy!

uk2LWPhKg5LzH1TJSb-kxw.text: Ordered the Roasted Duck Wonton Soup, and Shrimp Fried Rice with egg. This was the most flavorless food I've ever had from any restaurant ever! My first time trying this place and my absolute last time.

uItX8xuSN4uJQFnIVQHQiA.text: I would give zero star if possible. Don't come to SamWoo in Chinatown unless you want dry pork over rice or dry steak over scrambled egg rice. Worst Chinese dish we had ever. See pictures for yourself.

7RhugybCnccdRczwX82UYA.text: The Sam Woo name has strong reputation in Southern California, so it was a no brainer to stop by in Vegas for a good hearty Chinese meal.  Upon arrival you're greeted with a wall splattered with awards and top rating Zagat reviews.  But a closer look at reveal dates from the early 2000s.  I should've known this was a precursor of what's to come.  We arrived after the lunch hour and the restaurant was not full.  There was one waitress serving about 5 tables and a busboy cleaning up.  No one greeted us for nearly five minutes. Finally the busboy waved at us over to a table. After we sat, he notified the waitress of our arrival.  The waitress didn't even look over but rather continued over to the wait station to grab plates and utensils to set a table that was just cleaned up.  It was the busboy who grabbed some menus and brought them over and gave an apologetic smile. Behind the cash register the owner was busy with a personal call on her cellphone.  Meanwhile another family stood waiting to be seated for next several minutes.  When it was time to place our order,  it was again our heroic busboy who grabbed the waitress' attention.  We ordered a combo BBQ pork, roast duck, chicken rice plate, wonton noodles and chicken porridge. The BBQ meat was bland and chewy as noted by other Yelpers.  The BBQ chicken and duck were all the boney parts with little meat. The porridge had great texture but unfortunately tasteless. The wonton noodle soup was nasty as hell as the broth tasted like a mixture of the daily soup base mixed with msg from instant wonton noodle packages.  This place was probably the best Chinese food in town 15 years ago, but it's obvious now the restaurant relies solely on past reputation to stay in business.  Negative stars for the business but 5 stars to the heroic busboy.

fKe26vQlbZxj4lrWI-zMxA.text: Hmm, was really surprised by the review average here as the food is not as bad as some make it out to be.  Granted, this is a Sam Woo and they generally serve decent Hong Kong BBQ along with other Chinese dishes. This location is not as good as the ones in So Cal, but not bad overall for Vegas. Can't go wrong with staples like the roast duck, sauteed ong choy, steamed chicken, etc.  This place will work for those wanting some traditional Chinese cuisine while in Vegas.

ZN2kGzj2N2PsTee9Plwbiw.text: I really want to give Sam Woo a negative star.  This place was horrible...  our waiter did not comprehend anything we asked for?  We told him one of us had a shell fish allergy his response was "no".  Do you have unsweetened ice tea? "no" Do you have lemons? " No".  Do you have Diet Coke ? " No".  Diet anything?  "No". We ordered the chicken, duck and pork bbq with fried rice.  The chicken was disgusting.... they just chop everything and you get more bones than the tasteless chicken meat. The pork tasted a day old.  I've eaten at restaurants in Houston's China town and loved them but this place was disgusting.  Don't go here unless you don t mind chopping on bones and organs cold and bland food

cEAnY8qmI72eGTh03VE3dg.text: Bought a couple of fried noodles to go.  They use styrofoam boxes to pack them in.  However they don't bother to line the boxes with foil.  The heat melted the styrofoam to the point that a hole was burnt on the bottom of the box.  Very irresponsible and unhealthy. The toxins leaked all into the food. Hard to believe all these years the restaurant has been there yet does not care about this.  Wonder if the owner(s) or employees will eat food packed this way?

b-S9XLxA0dC8Fm4kQS2ZNQ.text: Coming back from Utah we stopped at Las Vegas to grab lunch and we stumbled upon Sam Woo BBQ Restaurant. I've got to say, this place was alright. The food was pretty good, especially the Mongolian Beef. That was the best! The worst had to be the soup as it was very bland and had absolutely no flavor at all. The service was alright as we got our food quick and everything we needed. However, there was no water and we got tea instead which was kind of sad ;(. Overall the place is ok for casual dining and such. Not highly recommended but, still an ok place for quick Classic Chinese food. :)

noJHqz3Mi4CueeYtGMrlZA.text: Like most Sam Woos the good es superb but service is sub par. Food 5 stars.  Service 3 stars. The food makes me come back again and again.

t3Gwt4KKvEm5HvDRmtGZ5A.text: Double check your bill. They will rip you off by adding stuff you did not order. We were charged soda and iced coffee. And to top it off THEY ADDED 18% tip (there's only 3 of us)  All together it was $13 added to our bill. The food is also expensive for a regular tasting chinese food.

LUPVkmyi9vwO2dMKdmS7MQ.text: The service and attitudes at this place is very very BAD.  It was so bad I felt like walking out. The food is only slightly better than the service.  What happened to this place?? Never coming back.   If you want good Chinese food, then try Grand Wok at MGM Grand. Super excellent service, best Chinese Food in America, clean, but you'll pay about 2X or 3X more than the typical Chinatown restaurant. It's totally worth the price than to suffer through this Sham Woo Bullsh*t. (If you want exotic, authentic Chinese food, ask for their Chinese/VIP menu which is not handed out unless requested).

qLBd2lUKXTpxLERK766aLA.text: So we came for lunch and I ordered the #96 seafood with fried rice. I was given seafood fried noodles with a lot of sea food so I reminded them of the fried rice not noodles. They brought me out a pile of fried rice with 2 pieces of shrimp on it. Literally 2 small pieces of shrimp. I asked them why only 2 small pieces of shrimp and no seafood like the previous dish. They told me it would be $3 more if I wanted the same seafood as seafood and fried noodles. I decided not to order at that point but they wouldn't accept that answer and I had 2 people around my table going over the menu offering suggestions that had nothing to do with what I wanted.  I finally settled for the bland and tasteless wonton noodle soup just to get then to leave me alone. No water served ever and you get tea whether you want it or not.   We'll never return here again.

NJ17Si8L2UNXY7yeeO8azw.text: I haven't been to a Sam Woo since my childhood days in SoCal so it was nice to try the Vegas location for the nostalgia factor alone.  Food:  Had the (a) combo BBQ pork and roast duck and (b) Chinese watercress as a veggie for about $30 total after tax but before tip. The roast duck was very good, very crispy. The pork was pretty tender, but could have benefited from soy sauce on the side. (Pictures below)  Service:  Food aside, the following part of this review is for the restaurant owners themselves: you need to train your Asian workers to treat the Latino busboys better. I may have gone at a dead hour (1:30/2pm on a Monday), but the person I saw working the hardest was the Latino busboy. The guy, whose name I found out to be Louis or maybe Louie because people shouted at him so often, busted his butt taking orders at 6 tables (by my count) and went back and forth between the front and back of house duties.  As someone who worked in immigrant rights, I understand (but am ashamed by) the uneasy tension between various immigrant groups. In any case, I always try and support immigrant businesses in every city I visit. During today's visit, it was very appalling to watch an Asian immigrant female restaurant worker push Louie/Louis as he backed up into her as he waited on a table. A simple "excuse me" or "behind" (in restaurant parlance) is not hard to say. Teach your workers kindness!  (FWIW, I tipped 30 percent, hoping Louie/Louis will receive most of that tip)

QxtNd5siHJE7oFSgP2th8Q.text: Worst wonton noodle soup I have ever had in my life! The noodles were super soggy and the broth was nasty.... what a big disappointment for the Sam Woo name!

xr7Q4ipdpaSLILJCY4vL1w.text: It's terrible service and it's terrible charging for refills of tea and it's charging for people to wait in line behind us and we haven't finished eating yet and we're rushing people!never come back

-CjpndkQi1oAcok8gS4ERQ.text: Sam Woo? More like Sham Woo. Food was way below par and super bland. The Chow Fun had little flavour and definitely needed way more seasoning. The wonton soup tasted a little weird and old that we were afraid to even eat it. The porage was bland and tasted like toilet water along with a very sour taste that was not normal. Service was okay as he kept forgetting items at our table but understandable that he was the only one that was serving the whole resturaunt. I went out with my stomach half full since I was too scared to eat anything else.

wgkZ3drrYKHF-Rc7txC_uw.text: If I have to rate zero star, I would!  Veggies are 3/4 yellows,  egg plant hot pot and won ton soup noodles are tasteless,  have to add hot sause and soy sause to eat.  They gave us BBQ pork end burn piece.  We don't even feel any AC on while it is over 100 degree outside.  Want to know more?  6 dishes cost $97.  Charge us $12 tips for 5 people dining.  Ridiculous over charge for bad service.  DO NOT RECOMMEND ANYONE.

photos.caption: Photo of Sam Woo BBQ Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasteless

agyWeUNmbkG9s67TuWKcDg.text: Big asian family gathering in Vegas, must be topped off by a dinner at an asian restaurant. Alright, fine by me because that's what asian people do. I ask my aunt where are we eating, she says, "we're going to Sam Woo's." I'm like, okay sounds good, *proceeds to yelp it*. My reaction - oh god!!!!! Two stars! This is worse than playing black jack and the dealer hitting black jack four straight times!  The first dish that came out was the walnut shrimp. The amount of mayo they used was egregious and just ruined my appetite. The mayo was thick and oily, it reminded me of solidified fat. I only ate one piece of shrimp and I tried to remove as much mayo as possible but I was no match for the mexican cooks.  I never knew I could ruin my appetite from eating one piece of walnut shrimp. I even uploaded a picture of the shrimp!   NO BUENO!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sam Woo BBQ Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Too much mayo. No bueno.

4yW_iZbf7C2Ac7i5BY9fig.text: Here's the breakdown...  Food: We ordered Mapo Tofu, Orange Chicken, Ong Choy with Garlic, Roast Duck, and a Seafood Hotpot. What saved this review from being only 1 star is the roast duck, tbh, which makes sense because BBQ is their specialty. However, it was the only dish that was even remotely tasty. Mapo Tofu had no flavor, tasted like thick, bland soup. Seafood Hot Pot wasn't too awful but still plain. Ong Choy also lacked flavor even though there was garlic in it, might as well have been without because you literally couldn't taste it. Honestly, don't even get me started about the Orange Chicken. I ordered it as the "safe" entree as in how could anyone mess up orange chicken?! But when it came out, it looked nothing like orange chicken and didn't taste anything like it, it was chicken bits drenched in a pool of a dark brownish almost black sauce that made me think it was sweet and sour, (emphasis on the sour), nothing like orange chicken that you get from anywhere else!   Service: Servers are inattentive and kind of just disappear after handing you your food.  Also, a cricket was hopping around on the floor.. Yikes.

zEgXShNB5r-esog68eEqiw.text: Salt and pepper wings came without salt. Rice porridge with pork was bland-they make regular white porridge and then add the pork, which adds no flavor. BBQ duck and pork with rice dish was pretty good.

GEShpE8O4BNHBSxWUwxaCw.text: This place sucks balls! Supposedly closes at midnight yet they proceeded to usher us out at 11pm. Never asked us if we wanted anything to drink. We had to ask for something to drink then the waiter takes two drink orders when there is three of us sitting there. I'll leave it at this since I could go on and be brutally honest. No wonder nobody was here on a Saturday night.

IRA6rS6YtKl-52m0pBZ-KQ.text: Okay, I'll admit that I can see why this place gets (a lot) of low ratings, but my experience at least was pretty good. Yeah, I can see the service being not stellar but I'll be honest, this is pretty typical for a lot of Chinese restaurants run by Chinese. You'll probably fare better if you can speak the language, and since I do I can't say how it would be if I didn't.  Our waiter wasn't like exceptionally friendly or anything but he didn't scowl or was rude; just doin' his job, really. We ordered their specialty meats and Hong Kong style wonton noodle soup--excellent. Perhaps some people might find it too greasy, but I thought it tasted excellent. Especially when it's 9:30pm and you've been driving all day and you're tired + hungry.  I will say it is on the pricy side compared most restaurants like this; but hey, at least for me the food was worth it. Didn't have to wait long either, though I did got well after most dinner hours.

1b64zpCaq25vkxVcP1aDjA.text: not bad at first... but the food and service are getting worse  and worse now, they only take cash, and that's also ridiculous to me...   BE CAREFUL when you order TO GO FOOD... because they usually are so absent-minded about what you ordered, and if you pick up without checking what's inside, you may be shocked  opening the box when you arrive home... they gave me wrong food boxes for twice!!  I don't trust them anymore, don't want to have dinner there anymore, and will warn people who want to try them... it's not a good idea if you are expecting something nice.  I gave it one star because I couldn't choose zero.

hMCwArAV0dL6Aj_1BJ6NRg.text: This one is always packed, 2 stars is a bit harsh but it is barely 3 stars.  People just don't know better place to go and all end up here.  The bbq is ok but nothing special, you always wait a long time, and service is, well, Asian. Price is OK considering it is Chinatown in Vegas.

EqZ9t4nmLZlMoTjNLcHspg.text: This place is riding off its reputation from the 90s. The food is disappointing, service is terrible, prices are way too high, I don't see why people would ever return.   Shop around to other places for a better experience. I would recommend hk star.

S0AbWzS5fclW0-Csn-DyDA.text: My honest opinion...go someplace else for Chinese BBQ! The price and quality just does not match up.    I ordered the char siu and the roasted duck, nothing was very memorable and the price was just too expensive for the amount I received.  After paying and picking up my bag, I was surprised how light it felt for the amount I paid.    If you think I'm being "chang" (i.e. cheap), be my guest, go there and check it out yourself!   Now onto the food.  One question, where is the flavor?    One bite into the duck, nothing...just meat and fatty skin and the sauce over the duck, but no flavor within the meat.  Usually roasted duck should have a smokey flavor to it, this duck lacked it!    Char siu (BBQ pork) was ok. Again, not much flavor and usually char siu has a real distinct flavor.    All I can say is I am still on my quest to find the best Asian BBQ place in town!

ApHqOoLvrkVEy2uqeEjo0Q.text: There's a Sam Woo at vegas?  It better be damn good!  Unforunately, it was not.  It was some of the most blandest chinese food i've ever had.  It's super authentic because I can taste the gutter oil here.  The food was extremely greasy and under seasoned.  It was all lukewarm and it just wasn't very good.  The only thing this place has it going for them is that it's open pretty late.  Other than that, stay away from here.

MG-xifmdhKVpat42PbQ-ug.text: Salty chicken wings and spare ribs salt and garlic are dry and plain deep fried. The deep fried flounder is way expensive with what they offered. The service was ok . Not recommended for an authentic Chinese restaurant.

BULIiTMfURCNB6OpGOff0A.text: Good food, I truly recommend this place. Amazing dining room setting to. My only biggest issue with this place is the service. I think the service could be better. Our server didn't hardly come over to check on us or ask if we wanted any refills at all. But later on a very nice lady that happen to be working in the front, checked on us by the time we was ready to pay the bill. Also when we first came in, it took awhile for someone to come seat us. Also when the server came to get our drink order, I ask for ice water but he gave me ice tea instead. Other than that, the food was delicious and the lady that came to our table that was working in the front, was very nice. I do recommend this place though, not bad pricing either. Me and my friend order a few dishes, and we had like our own feast, we split each dish. Then we each split the bill, wasn't alot of money. Last thing I recommend, is the restaurant should have silverware on the table, not just the Tia sticks cause not everyone knows how to use those.

Nh8WtyK9bptAmD7OgiJVFQ.text: Never heard of Sam Woo before, but apparently my family comes here all the time. As you step in the restaurant, you are surprised with the roasted pig and chicken hanging behind the glass wall.   I came here with my family. We were seated in one of the large tables and right next to us was another family. It was practically just two parties in this restaurant, cramped next to each other. I was unsure why they didn't seat us separately so we would have more room.   We ordered honey walnut shrimp, Mongolian beef, house fried rice, wonton soup, noodle soup, roasted pig, and flounder fish. (very typical dishes)  Fried rice and flounder fish was okay. The honey walnut shrimp and Mongolian beef was nothing I've ever tasted before. It tasted very different. I expected it to be the same taste with what you would usually get from a Chinese restaurant. But these dishes were so off.  The only thing I liked was the roasted pig which is filled so much cholesterol!   Cash only!!
