Xv35XGCqEpYlWMYzaXK8Ew.text: They do take credit cards! So sad to see their reviews have gone down. I still love their super thin egg noodles in their won ton mein and their roast duck was perfectly seasons and crispy. Pork was also tasty. I remember when this place used to be packed with people!! I guess a lot more competition in the area these days. Maybe a little rebranding or a yelp coupon would help them, LOL!

gFTkWz0y0VYa4a20QVVSYw.text: Have had better experiences at other Sam Woo locations in California. We ordered roasted pork with rice and beef chow fun with black bean sauce. While the food was served quickly, the rice was lukewarm, the chow fun noodle dish was bland and the rice noodles did not seem fresh. The dishes were pricier compared with other Sam Woo BBQ Restaurants and other restaurants in the Chinatown area. Also, the service was not very attentive, and our table, seats, and window nearby were not very clean.   Will most likely not return - there are better Chinese restaurants in the area!

q0Qyfn3EIne4r7v222vCRA.text: Ok take two in china town we had a completely amazing experience good food and great service. I would highly recommend this place to everyone. Try the hot pot was amazing. Very traditional and they even give you tea which is a lost cause in most restaurants these days.

cQzp82TnSVXGa6NLcTdI-w.text: A rip off. 3 roasted combo charged me $18.50 and wasn't even one the menu. I could foresee this place going out of business very soon. Btw the male old server was very rude. Stay away.

3aHCsTkEd98mPefBjrO5Pg.text: So so so bad.   Stopped in on a whim with the kids and was sat immediately. The servers were way too pushy to get us to order before we had a chance to even read the menu. We ordered drinks and only a few of us got them. Ordered food that was pricey but figured it would be at least somewhat good. NO! NO! Horrid. They forgot to bring my daughters food and she considered herself lucky. The cups they poured the soda in smelled and tasted of dirty dish water but even after they rush you to order, they don't come to check on you at all until you chase them down. Then they say they will fix it then don't come back.   I ended up being overcharged for what we got and still charged for the food we didn't get. Then on top of it all, they wrote in a mandatory tip that was was waaaaaaaaaay to much for what it should have been without even noting that it was a tip. Snuck it in as an additional charge. I ended up paying almost $100 for what should only have been a $68.00 tab (including the food that we didn't get).  The Google reviews on this place is now 2.2 I wish I would have seen that first.

QlmOQ63SicPzvqGfiDJsXg.text: If you like RUDE service and leftover food. You are welcome!  Seems like I owed the server million dollar when she was serving me.   A lot of dishes not available but still show in the menu.   The food quality is bad. The roasted duck I ordered seems like left over from yesterday. (I am a roast duck lover and been eating roasted duck over the years in different countries and cities like Hong Kong, Beijing, Vietnam, Malaysia, Singapore, Taiwan and so on). I can tell what is fresh and what is good on roasted duck.

photos.caption: Photo of Sam Woo BBQ Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the meat is yellow Means the meats already been exposed in the air for more than 24 hrs.

kLGq5Dv5JYqqaq_JzSh3KQ.text: My family and I came here twice, the first time we got 2lbs of roast pork to go, it was pretty good. So about a month later we were craving that again so we came back for the same thing. I ordered 1.5 lbs this time... we got home and opened the container and half of the cuts he gave were all bones! WTF! I was pissed! I paid for fu*kin bones? These rip off bastards. The guy knew what he was giving us, I've eaten roast pork for years in many, many different restaurants and they NEVER have bones in it. If they can do this to me, who knows what else they do to others in other ways, just to save money... scary shit. I can't wait to go back there and confront them about this. I've even seen Chinese restaurants re-use the rice that people don't eat,  not saying these guys do it, but....

wwg6O8d9TIQhXXoxhYIEQw.text: Wonderful food ! Always made sure to check this place out when I am looking to get some food. Chinese food from this place always made sure I leave with full gut and delicious meal!

7k3h9ngp4g7yyeEOyOthEA.text: I don't want to talk about the food or service. You know what, they are cheater. I ordered Roast pork, and they serve us chicken, covered with several cold tough roast pork skin. I complained and here is what I have,"the chief just pickup a piece of chicken by mistake." A chief cannot figure out chicken and pork, even before cut them into slides. Do you believe it?

uAPJ_aJEH3uT0LBG8KOjrA.text: Decent Chinese fare on Spring Mountain.  Prices are slightly above average due to the famous name, but definitely cheaper than any Chinese food on the strip.  If you want some quick, decent Chinese food, and have access to a car, then hit up Sam Woo

L4RddyaxN1fyKGCzNkuIkQ.text: Please dont come here.. the waiters are really rude and they try to rush you. They are short handed and the service is really bad. The waiter just throw the menu on our table without saying anything but then again that's typical in a Chinese restaurant

tZTOkmSF5M65u_gG12xKmw.text: Four words --- Roasted duck, roasted pork.  NOT to MISS.  Arguably the best roasted duck I've every had in the U.S.  Also tried their wonton noodle soup and pan fried gai lan with garlic sauce.  Wonton noodle soup was decent.  Gai lan was even better.  But the True shining stars were their roasted meats.  Bon appetit!

SeEYJnTdEO5vUID7S_q-Mw.text: Never come to this place ever ever again. Highly UNrecommended. This is the worse Chinese restaurant I've seen in my life. Extremely bad service. The waitress face was like someone dead. When writing order, she just want to rush you complete the order and very unprofessional.  Food wise, the bbq pork meat looks like cooked and sit here for a long time. The ribs are in giant pieces and majority of them are bone. The vegetables are not fresh.  Overall, One star is way too much for this restaurant. What a joke!

mUxRxwszIaM-A4kq4Woucw.text: My roommate and I thought we'd check out Sam woo BBQ. Pictures looked great. Ordered the BBQ pork and duck on rice. Looked great. Bit into it and the duck had bones. No warning, so that was real pleasant. The pork was dry and the crust of it was so hard I couldn't even bite it. Rice and flavor was good. Service was horrible. Don't know if that's a common thing, cause we received bad service at the last Asian place we ate, or if it's cause we're not Asian. I will not come again. And I'm pretty sure I'm won't be checking out any more restaurants in China Town.

TY6dGbspdcBmzi7QD6B3qQ.text: My family and I came here a few weeks ago when we were visiting Las Vegas with friends. I'm not sure why there are unfavorable reviews. We personally felt that this place has excellent customer service! All of the waiters were very attentive and friendly! Two of us ordered the roast pork wonton, which was absolutely delicious! I really should have taken photos of all of our dishes. But I only took a photo of my own roast duck wonton bowl.   Even though this place is in the heart of Las Vegas' Chinatown, we felt like the meat, dishes, and bowls were much tastier than some of the meat we had at the hotel/casino buffets on the Las Vegas Strip! And the food at Sam Woo is so much more reasonably priced, too! I would highly recommend this place to anyone who is craving good Chinese food!

photos.caption: Photo of Sam Woo BBQ Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My roast duck wonton bowl! Very delicious!!

LJPheLiTyWz8N2Yw8Vw6Kw.text: I haven't been here for many years so decided to go back for lunch. The place looked the same. One thing that should have raised a red flag is that on the menu a lot of the prices are blacked out. The rest are poorly written over on white tape. My friend pointed to a pictured item in the menu and asked the waiter for a price. When the final bill came, we noticed that my friend's item came out +$4 above what he was told by the waiter. My item is $2 more than what I saw in the menu. We talked to the waiter to no avail as he kept denying what he told my friend. We decided to pay and get out of there but don't tip a cent. The whole experience kinda left a bad taste. Won't be back there again and learned the lesson to avoid unfamiliar places where the prices are blacked out.

R0HyUCmmP9-sOjaQhNI_DA.text: Dirty place and horrible service, I wish yelp has "-5 stars". First off, we walked in and we weren't greeted at all. We went to a table and it was completely dirty. We asked 3 times for somebody to wipe our table. After that, we waved our hands to get the employees attention so that we can order. Nobody noticed us. One employee said she was off her shift, but she was still working the entire time we were there. She lied to us. Finally, a waiter came and took our order. We ordered three dishes and were told it's all sold out. He then asked us what we wanted to eat and we asked what they have available. We asked about the lobster, he then looked at his watch (indicating he doesn't want us to order). I didn't expect good service from this place but not horrible service. The good thing about this place is that it made me write my first review ever!

MXSmwxRKd9XQf_MIXEPI2w.text: Bad and overpriced.   I've been to other Sam woo places and other Sam wood are better.   I'm never coming back.

vWRqsXvbg7saKbDOYV8vTg.text: I have been to many Sam Woo restaurants and each one seems to FAIL everytime..mediocure customer service, expensive for food that I can make better at home!!!!! I had Chinese broccoli in garlic sauce and after 2 bites...it chewed on something hard, spitted out and it appeared to be a piece of rock/sand and clam in basil sauce is normally good at other places unfortunately this place, I had a few awful, ROTTEN tasting clams; vomitted!! I had to ask for RICE and ginger green onion sause for my steamed chicken, RIDICULOUS!!! It is automatically given!!!!

trYMMz5uBzA6AvMHtaAItw.text: I grew up shopping around this restaurant. My mom stopped letting us come here because she said they had "bad attitude," but I'd always assumed that maybe it was just a one-time exception that left a bad impression on her. Came back today for the first time in years with my dad to try it again. It was one of the worst experiences I've had at a Chinese restaurant. I usually don't give low ratings on Yelp ("if you don't have anything nice to say, don't say it"), but the service was so rude I'm still upset about it.   We came in around 2pm, and there was barely anyone there. Half the tables weren't cleaned and they said we could sit in the corner. My dad wanted to sit by the window so we asked if we could wait for one of the tables after it was cleaned. That must have ticked off the waitress because when she came to take our order, she wouldn't even look at us in the eye. My dad asked her if they had a certain dish and she just said, "Whatever's in the menu is what we have." I asked for the BBQ pork and duck combo which is what they are known for. It took them twenty minutes to bring it out, and they intentionally (I say intentionally because I saw plenty of other meat available) served us the end pieces of the pork that were not even chewable. I am not exaggerating.   We paid for a combo plate and we couldn't eat half of it. I am not by any means a picky eater, but the pieces of pork were so hard that there was no meat, just crust. My dad couldn't eat it at all. I didn't even know what to say because I was pretty sure at that point they were trying to piss us off. I know that yelp reviews shouldn't be based so heavily on service, but if anyone's reading this, I'm giving you fair warning: I tried to give this place another chance but it will ruin your appetite.

lFs1ZfG8CHHi6Z1mnRAz1g.text: Wow this place sucks. I was optimistic with the bad reviews/2 stars... but since we go to the one in Cerritos (not even sure if its even related/connected with that location)-- we figured hey it cant be that bad here. anyways, arrived we got seated 2 tables - big party of 16 , 9 being kids--  we werent given a menu til we asked, we had to flag em to take our order. We asked for spoons, lady said "no more spoons" , like say what?  Our orange beef didnt come. The eggplant tasted "fishy".The pan fried "crispy" noodles was all sauce/gravy...even before mixing it - noodlles already limp and mushy. Yang chow bland. Maybe I wAs noticing things too much since it was pretty much on a downward spirAl eversince we got seated. Never again. They were still packed though , go figure... either new optimistic patrons like us or just some people who gives no Fu**s about service or food... go try at your own risk. Be brave or judge it by the reviews... wish we shouldve went with reviews. Oh well.

O8Hw8Sj45jwzHldioq6C1A.text: Terrible food. Terrible service. Just ate here and it was disgusting. Don't waste your time. Waitress didn't even ask what we want to drink and gave us the eye roll when asked for separate checks. Food was not fresh. I'm mad at myself for  tipping them.  Waste of time and money and to top it off my stomach hurts now. Yuck!

KFguf8hKQtQETTl-Q-XD3A.text: My friend and I ate at Sam Woo this afternoon @1:00 PM. We were greeted, immediately upon entering the restaurant and seated by a gentleman. He also brought us a couple of menus to look at. Our waitress took our order within a few minutes after we had a chance to look over the large menu. My friend ordered sauteed duck(bone in) over rice, I had porridge with ground beef and we shared a won ton soup. All 3 dishes came out promptly, were piping hot and delicious. I used to eat at this restaurant quite regularly before I moved to California. Now that I am back in Las Vegas for awhile, I hope to again.

gKP-yKyz7hxpqSXDqQkedw.text: Snobby attitude... we ordered noodle soup and congee and told the server it had no seasoning in it... she went to the next table and grabbed us some salt... oh gee thanks, never again! Service sucks and food literally stinks! Look at your bill closely, they add gratuity, we requested it to be off our bill cus the server didnt do shit for us, we decided to tip the buster, a Mexican guy, instead. Much more friendlier and helpful!

wSyOLkR5SLl0kBDgWaGlZg.text: This place used to be my late night go to years ago and was actually really good.  That's not the case anymore. Not only does the service still suck, well it got worse, but their food is disgusting! And forget about complaining about anything, they bring your bill anyway even after they see you didn't even eat their food! Do not waste your time or money in this dirty, disgusting place! There's so many other wonderful options out here.

QpMv14WWczzNj1BRcNxIxg.text: We arrived during lunch hour. For a restaurant with so many tables, we didn't see a single waiter on the floor. Eventually one waitress showed up, she seemed to be serving all the tables. Understandably, you won't get lots of attention or fast service. We ordered basic food, several common menu items were not available. Most food taste ok, except for Liang Mian Huang which is soggy and salty. Ban Zhan Ji comes freshly cooked therefore warm, different from many other restaurants.

wuUz9LoyjIQehftKASVXOg.text: The porridge here is awful. Even when I poured a spoonful of soy sauce in it still tasted like nothing. (How is that possible???)  Fried rice was okay, nothing amazing, very standard. Seafood noodle was also very plain and not exciting.   Quality of food and service here is just something I would never even waste my time on again. Not horrendous, but definitely will not be coming back. Ever.

jIzw95mTKhX47bJl9FAcaA.text: I have some friends that just love this place and have been coming here for years! They are always singing the praises of Sam Woo. Thy seem to especially like the duck here.  I have been here three times now and really trie to give this place every benefit of the doubt..  I just don't get it.  I was not impressed with the service (mediocre on a good day).  I was not impressed with the price (kind of pricey for what you get).  I was not impressed with the food (a lot of bones and just bland tasting meat in general).  This has happened every single time I've tried this place. My fiends that are so loyal to this place can have it...I am just not impressed at all.  2 stars.  Rating    Meh. I've definitely experienced better.

5KDpXl_E05kjOS4QFKahGg.text: Sometimes the smartest thing you can do for your stomach is give it a rest from all that buffet action In Las Vegas. That's where Sam Woo BBQ Restaurant comes into play.........  Looking for something light???? May I suggest the shrimp/pork won ton mein over here.  Ummmmm, a very light broth, with a few won ton dumplings, Chinese choi sum, & a very thin noodle. Just the right thing to keep you going, especially since I've been up for almost two days straight (man, am I tired!).  Looks like this small restaurant has a little take out "to go" section, and they even make their own roast pork, and roast duck.  I can see that Sam Woo's has won many awards in the past. The last was a Zaget award back in year 2012.  Lots of parking in the strip mall, service was fast.........but when you go during off hours, it shouldn't be a problem correct?

EafTtcxfPnK-oR-Pb4jMBQ.text: Chaotic......I mean, really bad.  The place carries with it, a very PROUD name but their staff and food has a lot to be desired.  I got suckered in by the reputation of the name.  There were mass people everywhere with no organization.  I could have sworn every waiter/waitress was a host with no clear organization to whom was really running the place.  Once seated, our orders taken took a long time and our food took just as long making back to our table.    The food:.....coming from the San Gabriel Valley in California, I would say I'm a good judge of late night foods....but this placed SUCKED!  I mean, we are just talking about Chow Fun and Wonton Mein yaw'l !!!!!!  Long story short....if you are looking for good eats off the strip and you happen to think, HEY....lets head up to Vegas Chinatown, you just might want to go to Tea Station.....get eats a drinks there.....drive by this place when you are done, and spit some boba at this place =P

0oD6Ccu5qbaHMTGrVPi5fg.text: Wow.  I've had Sam Woo in Chinatown LA and throughout the San Gabriel Valley many years ago, but this did not taste anything like what I was used to.  I came here a few days ago since we were in Las Vegas and my co-worker was craving Chinese food.  First off, the prices were way inflated for a Sam Woo restaurant.  Then when the food came, it was bland.  We ordered the Beef with chinese broccoli, house special chow mein, and sweet and sour chicken.  I am sad to say that the best part of the meal was the chow mein, which was only okay at best.  I guess we should have ordered duck, but that might have been a disappointed as well.  I should have known when there was only one other person in the entire restaurant before we sat down for dinner.

gc_lnxkUuglVT7Rl8jzutA.text: This place has dropped in food quality and taste. We usually always enjoy a good hearty Chinese deal, but was extremely disappointed. Won't be visiting here anymore. Bla and yuck.

0SuaKhMJgO92dd52152ZVg.text: Just left this POS restaurant feeling disgusted and disgusting. Long story short, found steel wool in my food. The staff was dismissive at best--offered to void the cost (after I expressed A LOT of disbelief). I recognize that this was a genuine human mistake, but currently, I can't get myself to really give a shit.

Nta8OTrD15r7rrAQlfFzLg.text: I just left this place with my boyfriend! We both ordered the #22 which is a rice dish with bbq pork and duck. It was  good, honestly nothing bad to say about it. The service was another story.   I can see what the other reviewer said about how if you're not Chinese (my bf and I are half viet) they totally disregard you. My boyfriend and I waited on our checks and boxes for our food for over 30 minutes! The servers were moving super fast catering to every other table except for ours.   I had to give it only 2 stars because the service was just that bad. Will probably never come back, even if the food was good. Don't recommend this place because it's not worth dealing with the bad service!

bXpGvbjdc5m2478-rew4-g.text: After travelling and not having Asian food for three days we decide to have some authetic Chinese food.  We know there is a Sam Woo in this neighborhood so we decide to check it out.  Of course it is more pricy than its counterpart in Los Angeles since a lot of ingrident had to be shipped from Los Angeles. The service is alright.  They took our order and bring our food in a reasonable time.  Neither fast nor slow.  Typical chinatown service and decoration.  I came to eat not to look at the decor or talk to the waiter.  If you want to look, go to the casino located in the strip.  If you want to talk, talk to your travelling compansion or watch a comedy show. We ordered: Beef chow Fun.  Very tasty. BBQ pork on steam rice.  Generous portion of pork.  Pork is a little bit on the salty side. Shrimp Fried Rice.  Good wok Flavor but low in salt to bring up the taste.  Shrimp is small. Seafood pan fried noodle.  Could use a little bit of soy sauce. Overall, the food is Ok but not very delicious.  Service is OK.  Portion is not as generious as the Los Angeles counterpart and more pricy, however, this is located in the middle of a desert.  Everyone here charge more than Los Angeles.

87QuspCObqObmf5CWWfzGg.text: After 5 hours of nonstop driving from SD to Las Vegas, the fam decided to stop by the "asian" area and get some food before we checked in at our hotel. Bad choice.  When you first walk in, you are greeted with a wall of awards, recognitions, and accolades from websites and critics. I've been to a Sam Woo BBQ before, and this was uncommon. I thought it would lead to a good start, I was wrong.  Those awards were issued in 2001, and boy, did they really change the restaurant till now. I ordered the roast pork and roast duck rice dish. Just to let you know, the prices for the food served here are double the price if the Sam Woo back in SD ($7-$10, Las Vegas Sam Woo $7-$20). Came pretty fast. The duck was OK, but the pork was really fatty. In fact, it was almost ALL fat. Not too good.  My dad, on the other hand, ordered the Singapore noodles. While we were eating our food and finishing up, his food hasnt even left the kitchen yet. We asked if they forgot his order, and one of the waiters jus rudely replied:  "Its coming out, wait."  After 10 minutes we asked again. Turned out they JUST started the order the second time we asked. The waiter didnt even acknowledge the chefs in the kitchen to see if they started. The food came, but the service spoke for itself already.  NO GOOD.

PuYq1EQEAFmI0QyaD4YyXg.text: Worst customer service ! Sign said that it s opened at 11am. There are customers waiting in front of restaurant at 10:55am ! I can see there are at least 3,4 workers inside walking around but none of them will open the door or acknowledge the customers ! At 11:02 am , they still don't open so we knocked on the door ! They just sit inside and give us sign saying they don't open till 12:00 pm ! It s ridiculous and rude !

w7sxVaMzeSdyBjOofVs3cw.text: The fact that this place was only rated 2 stars really had me wary. But this was my mom and her friends go-to Chinese restaurant in Chinatown, so the rest of the family decided to try it out. Again, we had 2 cranky toddlers so we ordered a beef chow fun right away to get the girls started. That dish came out QUICK, but in good timing. As soon as that came out, we ordered the rest of the dishes. Chinese broccoli, mushroom with fried tofu, fried fish cutlets, fried chicken. All decent. Restaurant seemed clean and service wasn't too bad (then again there weren't too many patrons for Friday noon).

Q808BVZ4yzVSJO9QDSBh-g.text: The worst place to be for food. Recommendation don't come. You will be ripped off and the food has no taste. The place is sticky and hard to live by. The restroom is even worse though. It is filthy,smelly, and disgusting. Don't come or u will find out what I mean.

EXEkfYD1bVwo5Zv1WVMAiQ.text: A giant cockroach (the size of my thumb) crawled up my friend's leg while we shared a 6-course meal amongst the 5 of us. A waiter just killed it and walked away.  Mediocre food, bad service, and unsanitary overall! Worst Sam Woo I've been to...

aT-QCqg8sbqDSvD4z8at0g.text: The BBQ was fat and the service was OK.  We had Sam Woo in Toronto and it was a lot better.  You need to get there early for there's a long wait. Noodles at Bellagio has better BBQ but pricier.

Ycq6RxD3vVPalQL7E_F7kA.text: Yep did not want a buffet in Vegas, so gotta go back to the asian roots and hit up the franchised asian spot sam woo. We had a group of like 10 people and ordered a grip load of food, all I wanted was the roasted pork which ya know I thought would come out the same sized plates as the rest, nope came in some small ass plate, guess they ran out........during the lunch time, where the fuck the boar go? The dunk was right on from other sam woos, so that didn't disappoint...but the eggplant did, it was bland, didn't have any spice to it or flavor.

t-JiI9vBhhFEnV6MHTvpqg.text: For a Chinese restaurant, this place is OVERPRICED.  Like seriously, there are plenty of places that serve the same food for a lot less.  I'm not impressed.  We ordered the clams sauteed in black bean sauce.  It was tasty and as expected.  it was a good portion. Then we had a veggie dish and then some noodle dish.  All in all, the food was pretty good, but the prices are just a little ridiculous.    The service is pretty much like many other Chinese restaurant, as expected.    Bottom line: I think I would look at other options before I come back here for their prices.

5ikEBuKynW1Sid_hC_mRig.text: Sam woo in Las Vegas should be avoided. Food is absolutely horrible compared to the various locations I've been to in Los Angeles and Toronto. Prices are 2 times more expensive but quality and service is really poor. Food was bland which is not typical of Chinese restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Sam Woo BBQ Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empty tables

0T-Qg35wgp8c6okc7Dm68Q.text: I would give it 0 stars if I could. Food is expensive and tasteless. My rice noodles wasn't even fully cooked. Don't eat here.

zwlEADqR__cQtEj-CEn01g.text: There are myriad questions one is acquainted with throughout the many vicissitudes of life, and one of them is: how the Fallujah is this place still in business?  It's been featured multiple times on Dirty Dining; translation: they've racked up enough health district violations and demerits to redeem them for a Sony Playstation 4 if demerits were like Chuck E. Cheese prize tickets.  The place is downright filthy, so much so that roaches wouldn't even inhabit it, and it's not for a lack of water either (as they are water bugs), because you have plenty of liquids (water + oil) on the kitchen floors, clearly visible from the cashier.  Also, my entire family once got sick eating here, and this fine establishment was in the papers the next day (this was before the internet achieved prominence). Hint, they were not featured for their signature roast duck either.  But yes, to those who are still heedless or with intrepid iron stomachs, continue to eat here, just wear diapers or take some Immodium beforehand.  Oh, and the char siu pork was dry. That and don't charge me $4 for a glass of Ovaltine.

NRt2_4wvdJ7NXWKmvTIO7A.text: Not a fan.  We stopped here randomly. The service was terrible, our waiter was pushy and wouldn't help us with questions. We never got water, but they did give us tea. My Mixed vegetable chow mein was ok, but the veggies were very bland. They were out of the pork dish my friend ordered. Also, when my friend asked for sweet and sour sauce and the waiter said they didn't have any. Then we asked someone else and they brought it.  The staff (managers i'm assuming) were sitting near us talking very loudly the WHOLE time. Annoying.  Finally we got our check it was completely in Chinese(I think) the only thing we could understand were the numbers. They even had some weird math going on, but we just said screw, paid and left. Not going back.   Moral of the story: there are a million other places to go in a .5 mile radius. Choose somewhere else.

h-R-lZRJl4RbR4IRhAEwhQ.text: Crap, crap, and major crap!  How this place is still in business puzzles me.  I live in SoCal so we know how the original Sam Woo taste like.  Always crowded here.  I don't know why but it is.  Probably because they think Sam Woo is the best bet for Chinese food.  WRONG.  Hostess has a nasty attitude with an ugly smug that I would like to wipe off.  Food is extremely short of bad.  C'mon! They give you all the reject meat for full price.  Shady.  Service is laughable! So stupid.  How can they expect good tips with an attitude like that?  The last straw was when we went up to pay the bill and the girl said we could leave the tip with her.  My mom tipped only $2 because they didn't do s**t ( I didn't think they deserved a dime) and that b**** had the nerve to sneer "that's not even 15%!" and gave us a nasty look.  She's lucky I let her have her hair still intact the way she was treating us.  I would have loved to give her a good beat down.  0 stars! Why can't I give this place 0 stars?! I hope this place burns down to the ground.

HYQQlJWEFEjENBYNsY1l_Q.text: Beware, they cheat you on tab . Especially if you order lots of dishes, they charge you more on each item, and dishes that you didn't ordered. Make sure you double check your bill before you pay...They food is just so so..

i5cvuMnDDa0IJTesPicdaw.text: Stop here for our last dinner in Vegas. Everything was over salted, I think I drink like a whole kettle of tea just for the soup I was eating and they wrote up our order wrong and brought out our orders to someone else. It alright if you want to eat fast and leave.

wT_-WUhM5J_uOcGe5VSNdg.text: Thought this place was REALLY good because it was the most crowded restaurant in the plaza, but this place was very disappointing.  Portions were small, prices were high (for the portions received), food was "okay," and the service was just mediocre.    It really upset my sister that this place automatically tacked on the tip to the bill.  There's no incentive for them to offer "good" service for a nice tip, because they know that they are getting their 15% tip no matter what.

7O9mVxyKMRUBAxAA4giCaA.text: Usually when I'm super hungry everything tastes good. But this place is disgusting. I'm not even picky about food that much - especially Chinese food. Their noodle sauce was sooooooo bland. We ordered class and when we got our dish, half of the clam shells in  DID NOT have any clams inside. The beef sauce tastes so salty and weird - it tasted more Korean than Chinese. Their service is terrible. Terrible terrible terrible. Waited like 7 minutes to be seated when there were plenty of seats available. Never checked up on us. The worst Chinese restaurant I've ever been to. DONT GO HERE

Qnqkxu_VqfhVnqGPZFZyhw.text: Thanks to my fellow Yelpers, I was the only one out of my party of 14 people who actually ordered a decent dish off the menu, which was the BBQ Pork and Duck with Rice. Since we had such a large group, we all sampled each other's entrees. I couldn't believe how disappointed I was with the other meals! The fried rice that my friend ordered was just so stale. And the Lo Mein that my boyfriend ordered was made with wonton noodles, which were tasteless and overcooked.  The language barrier we had with our waiter was difficult as well. I wish they would state to their customers before they take orders that they only take cash. The sign they have at the cash register wasn't eye-catching enough for us to notice on our own. I would also advise everyone to reevaluate your bill when they bring it to you. They write everything in Chinese so if you have a big order, it's hard to distinguish which item is which and whether they charged you the correct amount. Our large group has multiple separate checks and we found THREE miscalculations where they charged us more than the price that was displayed on the menu.  Overall, this is not a restaurant that really cares about their customers. They find small ways to gyp you and just because my group looked Americanized, doesn't mean we like our Asian food Americanized. Not worth going to unless you're going to order the BBQ Pork and Duck. I would've given them 2 stars, but since my dish was good, I'll add an extra star.

BP-z-YTJl3dy8zcJuYLj_w.text: We're regulars at Sam Woo in San Diego for its excellent food - never mind the customer service, but this place doesn't even compare.  The food was average at best, and they rip you off a few dollars more by calculating 15% tip on the total bill.  Yes, they add their 15% after calculating the bill and tax.  This is pure greed.  My wife told them that tips could not be calculated on the tax portion and that this is illegal and they recalculated it properly down by a few dollars.  [The larger Capital restaurant above it also has excellent food and didn't force tip on the bill like they did.]  We won't come back to this place again.

FZqR10ElACD9HzWKF6AsfA.text: I love the Peking duck. My husband and I come here at least once a month just for the duck. The waiter is quiet but other than that it is a decent place. I see others are talking about waiting on seats but my husband and I have always been promptly seated.

4FGVctfI77kdYQUBNuCNug.text: Possibly the worst service ever. If I can, I would give this place negative stars. My table waited over 15 minutes to place our order. After we placed our order, only half of the food came. The rest of my table waited for over 50 minutes until we asked the waiter again where our food was. The waiter said ,"It will come, you just placed your order!" I was frustrated because two tables that had arrived after my table had already gotten their food and was already finishing up!!   One thing that I noticed was that the servers favored the other two tables. This might be since they were not Asian! This place shows favoritism over which customers they want to provide good service to! This is just wrong. Service should be equal among all!  I will probably never come here again. My table called over the boss and server to talk to them. We asked them why our food had not come yet and told them that the other half of my table had already finished their plates. They treated us with so much disrespect! After being disguised with their manners, I refused to eat their food! We left without eating!

QvqB5BbPLuew42VDrTaFcA.text: Look, I have no illusion about the quality of Chinese Food in Las Vegas, nor am I expecting high end Chinese food from SW.   But the food at this location was down right nasty.  I've been on the road for several weeks now and I just needed a Chinese food fix.  So I came here for a very basic, simple Won Ton noodle and BBQ Pork.  Simple stuff - I can do this at home if I'm ever there!  But oh man the Won Ton was nasty.  It tasted like broiled ground pork - there was no flavor and the texture of the meat was all wrong. *shivering*  The BBQ port was okay, but it sat in the broth for too long and it was starting to get stringy.  This simple fare is a staple for Sam Woo man! How the hell did this joint nuke it this bad?  You know, I was so tired of hotel food that I was willing to take a few bite of this and move on.  But I'm never coming back to this place.  Amazing how this place managed to embarrass the already mediocre reputation that is Sam Woo...

VWylKzu2rE6aLyj2nsAWiA.text: This place used to be really good. I would go there once a month or so. Hadn't been there in a couple years and decided to stop in...  They had no iced tea, very weird for a restaurant. They brought my water out in a cup that stank like mildew or something and had some sort of white residue caked up on the insides of the cup.  I wasn't too hungry, the person I was with came to eat, I was just sort of tagging along, so I ordered the salt and pepper chicken wings. The person I was with got their food and ate more than half of it before my wings showed up. When they did show up you could taste the filthy oil. I'm guessing they haven't changed their fryer oil in quite some time.   On top of all of this, the servers lean against a wall in the dining area and stare at the customers without ever addressing them. After you get your food and drink, if you want something else, you have to get their attention and call them over.  All in all, this place is pretty terrible. Do yourself a favor and stay away

FP6KA_d9RHEZVa-yDlwTCQ.text: The food here was surprisingly good, given all the negative reviews. But that is where the goodness ends. Service and prices are piss poor. The waiter looked like he was ready to jump off a bridge. Service with a frown. Every menu item was over $10, even the stir fried chinese spinach. I can understand paying up for an upscale chinese eatery, but this place ain't even close.  Cash only is ridiculous given the high prices. But then again this is Vegas, where cash is king.

LHkVy72FoKnDUtogBnavgw.text: I only come here for the whole roasted duck.  And they do a good job for that item.  Nothing flashy, but solid.

89B6wTEB0QNLoOvUo0LFCg.text: For a while they were known as the go to place for Chinese BBQ. Now I wonder how they stay in business. With crooked practices, you have to watch them carefully.  On a few occasions, my family and I have been cheated by them. They have calculated our bill wrong. Then there are the times that they have taken a duck leg when we ordered a whole bird to take home. A one legged duck is not a common sight, so I do not know how they thought they could get away with it. My dad did not let this slide and raised hell. They of course apologized, but the next time another part was missing.   The food is nothing special compared to the prices they charge. Go upstairs to Capital Seafood or go down the street to Cafe Noodle. If you like Chinese BBQ go to the take out restaurant connected to the International Marketplace. They are a fraction of the price and do not try to pull the wool over their customers.

resWRYfQqftCYY1p1FHUYg.text: One star, zero if there was a zero rating! Walnut shrimp was terrible! Hair in my beef wanton noodles and service wasnt that great either, definitely not coming back

BX0rqhmG4hh-wuDNeftVyQ.text: Wasn't too fond of the food, quite bland. While I was waiting for a table, I noticed one of the employees dropped a cup on the floor and put it back on the table.

zndQmE6qTTxPMx0mrIfJWw.text: We hesitated to dine in this restaurant noticing it was empty which is kind of unusual because this place used to be very busy specially at dinner time on a Friday. We still went in and sat and to our surprise, the food prices weren't what they used to be. All items are $10 and up and nothing under. A small cup of white rice is $1.00. They used to be included free in some entrees. This perhaps explain why the place was unusually empty.

boDGPrSICNGfrBQKToO_mg.text: Do not come here, they used recycle oil to fry all stuff which will cause cancer. Health inspectors please check out this place. They also re-use old expired meat... Drinking Water alone tasted so bad, it is from tap water. Tip automatically added 15% to your bill regardless. The place looks very dirty.  If you don't want to get sick or cancer, stay away from this place.

8GBiQfGX1ZIJFfGENZ73rw.text: Really bad service . The food is not good . Only ok.  We been waiting for like 30 mins for our food to come .

BaAwiKZwrgvNdBR7FB3DAw.text: We went here over Memorial weekend for brunch after church. We wanted to go to Harbor Palace, because that's where we usually go...but it had a long wait. Sam Woo was our second stop. It was pretty crowded, as expected. When we walked in the hostess station was empty, so we made our way to the cashier and asked to be put on the waiting list. She rudely told us to go back to the hostess station and wait for her there. We were given a ticket with the number 1 on it, so I was pretty hopeful. After about 20 minutes of waiting, we noticed that people that arrived after us were being seated. We got even more suspicious when the hostess asked us again how many were in our party & gave us a ticket with the number 8 on it. Things were obviously very disorganized.  My mom then caught the hostess' attention and asked her exactly how their seating was conducted, because we had been waiting awhile, parties were being seated before us that arrived after, and she wasn't calling any numbers. Her reply was, and I kid you not "You know, don't worry about it. They have the bigger party and their table became available first. You just have to wait for a smaller table, so don't worry about it."  It was so rude. I think she realized she said something wrong, because as were were leaving (didn't want to patronize a place like that) she said "I have your table ready for you now." My mother turned around, handed her the ticket back and said "You know, don't worry about it."  The look on that hostess' face was priceless :)

5N58PKj1Dx-bFwH9mY3QVQ.text: Most of us that go to Sam Woos have been to the ones in OC and LA, so we sorta have an expectation for some decent Chinese food. However this place fails to deliver far below on our expectations. Not to mention they even have a Vegas markup on their prices. I guess they figure that most of their crowd are going to be from the casinos and want to save a bunch, why not gouge them anyway.  I ordered a chicken dish and beef dish, throw in some steam rice and we are already close to $30? How? I could've had a decent buffet meal at that price. I wouldn't complain if the food tasted somewhat comparable to the location in OC, but it was just bland Chinese food. The service was non-existent. That would explain why I left a penny for the tip.   I highly recommend staying away from this Sam Woo. There are probably some better Chinese options in the same parking lot that I would go with.

photos.caption: Photo of Sam Woo BBQ Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Picture of the front in the parking lot

1VXxxkklY0KWbRGaieWksg.text: I grew up to Sam Woo BBQ's Duck, every time I visit a Sam Woo wether it being the Vegas location or one of the very many locations in So Cal we always order duck. The BBQ items are very flavorful and succulent, the service on the other hand is horrible - comes with an attitude and a smirk :) The last time I visited the Vegas Sam Woo we didn't order family style like what I'm use to. Instead I ordered an entree of the Triple BBQ Wonton Lo Mein and it was AMAZING! A combination of lo main, wontons, and BBQ totally satisfied my appetite in all sorts of ways.
